page.title: 01Whitehall Village
page.content: This area of the island includes Whitehall Village. In the village there are three shops, one bank, one pub, and a post office. The shops stock food, sweets, icecream, and bread. At Christmas they take in toys and other nice things for Christmas. The school in the centre of the island teaches about sixty pupils and has four teachers with seven visiting teachers. When you are fourteen years old you have the chance to go to a shcool on the mainland where more education is given. The rest of the area consists mainly of farmland. The bank (The Bank of Scotland) is only open on a Thursday when a cashier comes out from the mainland. Another feature of the village area is the Weavers shop, he has a hand weave loom and specialises in tweeds. This shop is also an outlet for local knitters.
